arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: Clustering algorithm
arguments.name: --algorithm

arguments.summary: Strategy to use for choosing a representative alt allele for non-CNV biallelic sites with different subtypes.
arguments.name: --alt-allele-summary-strategy

options.summary:
Use the most specific subtype that doesn't conflict with any of the other alleles.
 For example, (<INS&gt, <INS:MEI:SVA&gt, <INS:MEI:LINE&gt) results in <INS:MEI&gt.
options.name: MOST_SPECIFIC_SUBTYPE

options.summary:
Use subtypes in common among all alleles.
 For example, (<INS&gt, <INS:MEI:SVA&gt, <INS:MEI&gt) results in <INS&gt.
options.name: COMMON_SUBTYPE

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Strategy to use for choosing a representative value for a breakpoint cluster.
arguments.name: --breakpoint-summary-strategy

options.summary: Use the (first) middle value to summarize cluster starts and ends, such that the start and end were seen in the data
options.name: MEDIAN_START_MEDIAN_END

options.summary: A conservative strategy to summarize a cluster by its smallest extent
options.name: MIN_START_MAX_END

options.summary: A permissive strategy to summarize a cluster by it largest extent
options.name: MAX_START_MIN_END

options.summary: Summarize a cluster using the mean value for each end, even if that value was not represented in any sample
options.name: MEAN_START_MEAN_END

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Convert inversions to BND records
arguments.name: --convert-inv-to-bnd
arguments.fulltext: When enabled, INV records will be converted to a pairs of BNDs prior to clustering.

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: Default to no-call GT (e.g. ./.) instead of reference alleles (e.g. 0/0) when a genotype is not available
arguments.name: --default-no-call
arguments.fulltext:
Default genotypes are assigned when they cannot be inferred from the inputs, such as when VCFs with different
 variants and samples are provided.

arguments.summary: Padding as a fraction of variant length for CNV defragmentation mode.
arguments.name: --defrag-padding-fraction

arguments.summary: Minimum sample overlap fraction. Use instead of --depth-sample-overlap in CNV defragmentation mode.
arguments.name: --defrag-sample-overlap

arguments.summary: Depth/Depth window size for breakend proximity
arguments.name: --depth-breakend-window
arguments.fulltext: Maximum allowed distance between endpoints (in bp) to cluster depth-only/depth-only variant pairs.

arguments.summary: Depth/Depth interval reciprocal overlap fraction
arguments.name: --depth-interval-overlap
arguments.fulltext: Minimum interval reciprocal overlap fraction to cluster depth-only/depth-only variant pairs.

arguments.summary: Depth/Depth shared sample overlap fraction
arguments.name: --depth-sample-overlap
arguments.fulltext: Minimum carrier sample reciprocal overlap fraction to cluster depth-only/depth-only variant pairs.

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: Read filters to be disabled before analysis
arguments.name: --disable-read-filter

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)
arguments.name: --disable-tool-default-read-filters

arguments.summary: Enable clustering DEL/DUP variants together as CNVs (does not apply to CNV defragmentation)
arguments.name: --enable-cnv
arguments.fulltext: When enabled, DEL and DUP variants will be clustered together. The resulting records with have an SVTYPE of CNV.

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: Fast mode. Drops hom-ref and no-call genotype fields and emits them as no-calls.
arguments.name: --fast-mode
arguments.fulltext:
Results in substantial space and time costs for large sample sets by clearing genotypes that are not needed for
 clustering, but any associated annotation fields will be set to null in the output.

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Strategy to use for choosing a representative value for insertion length when unknown.
arguments.name: --insertion-length-summary-strategy

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Depth/PESR window size for breakend proximity
arguments.name: --mixed-breakend-window
arguments.fulltext: Maximum allowed distance between endpoints (in bp) to cluster depth-only/PESR variant pairs.

arguments.summary: PESR/Depth interval reciprocal overlap fraction
arguments.name: --mixed-interval-overlap
arguments.fulltext: Minimum interval reciprocal overlap fraction to cluster depth-only/PESR variant pairs.

arguments.summary: Depth/PESR shared sample overlap fraction
arguments.name: --mixed-sample-overlap
arguments.fulltext: Minimum carrier sample reciprocal overlap fraction to cluster depth-only/PESR variant pairs.

arguments.summary: Omit cluster member ID annotations
arguments.name: --omit-members

arguments.summary: Output VCF
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: PESR/PESR window size for breakend proximity
arguments.name: --pesr-breakend-window
arguments.fulltext: Maximum allowed distance between endpoints (in bp) to cluster PESR/PESR variant pairs.

arguments.summary: PESR/PESR interval reciprocal overlap fraction
arguments.name: --pesr-interval-overlap
arguments.fulltext: Minimum interval reciprocal overlap fraction to cluster PESR/PESR variant pairs.

arguments.summary: PESR/PESR shared sample overlap fraction
arguments.name: --pesr-sample-overlap
arguments.fulltext: Minimum carrier sample reciprocal overlap fraction to cluster PESR/PESR variant pairs.

arguments.summary: Sample ploidy table (.tsv)
arguments.name: --ploidy-table
arguments.fulltext:
Expected format is tab-delimited and contains a header with the first column SAMPLE and remaining columns
 contig names. Each row corresponds to a sample, with the sample ID in the first column and contig ploidy
 integers in their respective columns.

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read filters to be applied before analysis
arguments.name: --read-filter

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: One or more VCF files containing variants
arguments.name: --variant

arguments.summary: If supplied, generate variant IDs with this prefix
arguments.name: --variant-prefix

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Clusters structural variants based on coordinates, event type, and supporting algorithms. Primary use cases include:

  • Clustering SVs produced by multiple callers, based on interval overlap, breakpoint proximity, and sample overlap.
  • Merging multiple SV VCFs with disjoint sets of samples and/or variants.
  • Defragmentation of copy number variants produced with depth-based callers.

Clustering tasks can be accomplished using one of two algorithms. The SINGLE_LINKAGE algorithm produces clusters for which all members cluster with at least one other member. The MAX_CLIQUE algorithm, however, requires that all members cluster with every other member. The latter is in general non-polynomial in time and space but implemented to minimize computations by traversing variants ordered by start position and efficiently finalizing "active" clusters that are determined to be complete.

The tool determines whether two given variants should cluster based following criteria:

  • Matching SV type. DEL and DUP are considered matching SV types if --enable-cnv is used and merged into a multi-allelic CNV type.
  • Matching breakend strands (BND and INV only)
  • Interval reciprocal overlap (inapplicable for BNDs).
  • Distance between corresponding event breakends (breakend window).
  • Sample reciprocal overlap, based on carrier status determined by available genotypes (GT fields). If no GT fields are called for a given variant, the tool attempts to find carriers based on copy number (CN field) and sample ploidy (as determined by the ECN FORMAT field).

For CNV defragmentation (DEFRAGMENT_CNV algorithm), the tool uses single-linkage clustering based on the following linkage criteria:

  • Must be a DEL/DUP/CNV and only be supported by a depth algorithm.
  • Matching SV type
  • Overlapping after padding both sides of each variant by the fraction of event length specified by --defrag-padding-fraction.
  • Sample overlap fraction (described above) specified by --defrag-sample-overlap.

Interval overlap, breakend window, and sample overlap parameters are defined for three combinations of event types using the ALGORITHMS field, which describes the type of evidence that was used to call the variant:

  • Depth-only - both variants have solely "depth" ALGORITHMS
  • PESR (paired-end/split-read) - both variants have at least one non-depth entry in ALGORITHMS
  • Mixed - one variant is depth-only and the other is PESR

Users must supply one or more VCFs containing SVs with the following info fields:

  • SVTYPE - event type (DEL, DUP, CNV, INS, INV, BND)
  • SVLEN - variant length for INS only, if known
  • STRANDS - breakend strands ("++", "+-", "-+", or "--") (BND and INV only)
  • CHROM2 / END2 - mate coordinates (BND only)
  • ALGORITHMS - list of supporting tools/algorithms. These names may be arbitrary, except for depth-based callers, which should be listed as "depth".

In addition, the following FORMAT fields must be defined:

  • GT - genotype alleles
  • ECN - expected copy number (i.e. ploidy)
  • CN - genotype copy number (DEL/DUP/CNV only)

Note that for CNVs (DEL, DUP, multi-allelic CNV), GT alleles are set according to the CN/ECN fields. In some cases, (e.g. diploid DUPs with CN 4), allele phasing cannot be determined unambiguously and GT is set with no-call alleles.

The tool generates a new VCF with clusters collapsed into single representative records. By default, a MEMBERS field is generated that lists the input variant IDs contained in that record's cluster.

Inputs

  • One or more SV VCFs

Output

  • Clustered VCF

Usage example

     gatk SVCluster \
       -V variants.vcf.gz \
       -O clustered.vcf.gz \
       --algorithm SINGLE_LINKAGE
name: SVCluster
